column4: I have strange problem. I use Ubuntu 8.10 and settings 1024*768@60
when I starrt system on my LCD I see INPUT IS OUT OF RANGE
so I swicth to CRT monitor, log into system and swict back to LCD
and now on LCD everything looks ok
so what may be a problem??
what make/model is the monitor?
and what video card?
not yet... was the LG plugged in when you turned the computer on?
and at what point, exactly, does the LG step out of frequency?
probably yes
If I understand you correctly, the system boots up with the ubuntu logo, then when the login screen proceeds to appear, it steps out of frequency then?
go ahead and pastebin xorg.conf *and* /var/log/Xorg.0.log
thanks, looking
I'm going to guess that your CRT monitor is made by CTX?
okay, because as I see it, you booted it up, this time anyway, with the CRT plugged in... are you able to ctrl-alt-F1?
okay - if you press ctrl-alt-F1, it should take you to a console - then use ctrl-alt-f7 to get back to the GUI
ok, I back for a moment, I will try
please
okay, your xorg.conf is trying to force a specific display down your monitor's throat. your monitor is saying: "uh, no."
why?
because different monitors have different frequency ranges, and this is especially true between CRT and LCD displays
try this one: http://pastebin.com/m5175cf4f
